intro: Tutcheria tawauensis, commonly known as the Tawau tutcheria, is a species of flowering plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
